title: All Things Arts And Architecture
text:
Welcome to my website!
I am Chen Junyu Ryan, a Year 2 Architecture aspiring to blend art and design. Ever since I was a kid, art has been a way for me to understand and express the world and my world. On this website, I offer a glimpse into my world, the exploration of the arts, architecture and projects that I am learning.
My interest in new media and learning more about the online world, comes from my journey with design. My journey with design has just began and I would like to explore and showcase as much as I can. I would like to influence and infuse my design with art to show a side that is unique to myself. My strength in art lies in oil painting, I have been painting for 4 years and I was awarded “highly commended” and shortlisted for UOB painting of the year 2008 and 2023 respectively.
My journey in design started in architecture school and it has impacted the way I view the world. Architecture is not only about buildings, but it is also about the people who inhabit these buildings.
On this website, you will find a selection of my artworks, architecture projects and design works. I invite you to explore my website and learn more about my life’s work.Please feel free to contact me if you have any commissions or enquirers on projects.

Instagram

title: Artworks
text:
Unlabelled is a collection of unlabelled bottles in varied sizes, filled with water and laid out in different configurations.
To the artist, the idea of identity is a fluid one that is never fixed, just like water. Here, the water takes on whatever shapes the bottles hold, a representation of one’s search for identity while growing up, attempting to fit into the different moulds and forms as dictated by societal norms. With the labels of the bottles peeled off, the artist is also suggesting that the search for identity is an endless and uncertain one. The bottles are leaning against one another precariously, highlighting the tension and struggle people go through during this search.

title: Artworks
text:
arXiv Preprint | Code
Over the centuries, I have devoted countless hours to deciphering and translating the ancient scripts and dialects of the various peoples of Middle-earth. My goal is to gain a deeper understanding of the cultures and histories of these peoples by studying their languages. Currently, I am working on a monograph that explores the linguistic roots of the Elvish languages. Through extensive research and analysis, I hope to shed light on the connections between the different dialects of Elvish and their origins. This project has been particularly challenging, as Elvish is a complex and nuanced language, but I am determined to see it through to completion.

title: Artworks
section: The History of the War of the Ring
text:
The History of the War of the Ring

arXiv Preprint | Code
I am creating a comprehensive and detailed history of the conflict that goes beyond the surface-level events. By gathering information from a variety of sources, including my own memories, written accounts, and oral histories, I hope to shed new light on this important period in Middle-earth’s history and provide valuable insights into the motivations and actions of the various players involved.

title: Artworks
text:
Queery

Pencil and iridescent plastic A close up view of plastic packaging shimmering and reflecting light. Abstracting the familiar plastic into something visually captivating by contrasting black and white with the flamboyant iridescent plastic. Viewers get lost in the details as they look through the drawing and start to wonder what they are looking at. Queery seeks to be questioned, what is the artist drawing and why did the artist draw this. I would like people to ask questions and get to know more about the art as well as the LGBTQ community.

View the tutorial for this template (+ download link)

title: Architecture
text: “Living With A Memory” explores the idea of intangible qualities. What are some ways in which architecture can foster a sense of curiosity and awe ? To explore these ideas, I studied physical qualities on site that could create fleeting moments that would help create and allude to the idea of memory. Making use of the trees and street lamps on site. The experience of the building changes throughout the day and night, as sunlight passes through the trees, the filigree of trees can be seen on the ground and wall. As night falls the street lamps cast shadows in the alley and the building lights up like a jem. —-

title: Architecture
text:
Y2S1 “Peek-A-Boo”

“Peek-A-Boo” was inspired by Chungking Express a film that captured lovers in a fragmented world. Through sections and exploration of aggregated form the collective building displays public and private interactions between users.
